prosody.p:
Organised crime gangs are now manufacturing their own branded weight-loss drugs.
These products are meticulously designed to look exactly like legitimate medicines.

The Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency, or MHRA, has issued a stark warning.
They've just conducted the largest single seizure of trafficked weight-loss drugs, highlighting a significant threat to public health.

Andy Morling, head of the MHRA's criminal enforcement unit, explains that this is a new and unusual production model.
These gangs are investing heavily in designing sophisticated packaging and branding, making their illegal products appear genuine.

Morling noted that while they looked like genuine medicines, they were entirely unlicensed and illegal to sell in the UK.
In a recent raid on an illegal factory in Northampton, the MHRA seized tens of thousands of empty weight-loss pens.

They also confiscated over 2,000 already filled, unlicensed pens, preventing them from reaching the market.
Morling emphasized that public safety is their top priority in every case.
The agency is taking a proportionate approach to this growing threat, focusing on removing these dangerous products from circulation to protect consumers.
